page.title: 10N.CAVE SCHOOL,OLD AND NEW
page.content:
It was a fine day. Most of the moving was on lorries. Teachers took boxes of things and for some weeks before, mothers, aunts and grandma's had been busy helping. The actual move took one day. Children helped to unload materials and everyone was very well behaved. The following morning was lessons as usual at 9.00 a.m. The official opening day was a very proud affair. The Lord Lieutenant of the County arrived exactly on time. There was afternoon tea and Lord Halifax and Mr. Swain, the headteacher, both made a speech.
The old school has been sold to be made into a home and the school had a party to celebrate ten years on its new site this year.
